html: It was a busy week: Took steps to protect the ACA & pre-existing conditions #ProtectOurCare Voted to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act #VAWA19 Introduced the VET PFAS Act to provide benefits to vets exposed to PFAS Voted to end the U.S. role in the war in Yemen
text:
It was a busy week:
Took steps to protect the ACA & pre-existing conditions #ProtectOurCare
Voted to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act #VAWA19
Introduced the VET PFAS Act to provide benefits to vets exposed to PFAS
Voted to end the U.S. role in the war in Yemen

html: Yesterday I joined a group of lawmakers to introduce the VET PFAS Act, requiring the VA to treat veterans exposed to PFAS contamination at military installations. Some vets & their families have been waiting decades for action on this. Let's get it done.https://www.fosters.com/news/20190404/lawmakers-file-bill-to-treat-vets-exposed-to-pfas …
text: Yesterday I joined a group of lawmakers to introduce the VET PFAS Act, requiring the VA to treat veterans exposed to PFAS contamination at military installations. html: This morning I joined @SenStabenow, @RepDanKildee, & others to introduce the Veterans Exposed to Toxic (VET) PFAS Act. This bill guarantees VA benefits for those exposed to PFAS contaminants through their service to our country. Veterans & their families deserve this commitment.pic.twitter.com/j7giVLe5lE
text: This morning I joined @SenStabenow, @RepDanKildee, & others to introduce the Veterans Exposed to Toxic (VET) PFAS Act. This bill guarantees VA benefits for those exposed to PFAS contaminants through their service to our country. Veterans & their families deserve this commitment.pic.twitter.com/j7giVLe5lE

html: To this Admin the shutdown is a political lever. To thousands of families, it's a financial crisis. Unless the Sen. & @POTUS act, many fed. workers will miss rent, utility, & insurance payments, & more. We owe it to our dedicated public servants to end this political madness now.

html: We’re on day 17 of the #TrumpShutdown. A government doesn't function when it doesn't pay its workers. We become less safe and less effective, and to what end? The Senate needs to take action today or so many dedicated federal employees won't get their next paycheck.
text:
We’re on day 17 of the #TrumpShutdown.

A government doesn't function when it doesn't pay its workers. We become less safe and less effective, and to what end? The Senate needs to take action today or so many dedicated federal employees won't get their next paycheck.

html: A govt shutdown means food stamp recipients will receive $90 less this month. If it continues into March, food stamps disappear for a vulnerable population. Our social safety net can’t sustain this hit. For help or Qs, contact our office: 603-285-4300 or http://pappas.house.gov .https://twitter.com/NBCNews/status/1081951607695253507 …

html: Within 7 hours of being sworn in, we voted to re-open the govt. Senate leaders are abandoning their responsibility and sitting on their hands while 800K federal workers are a day away from their next paycheck being withheld. This is outrageous even by Washington standards.
text: Within 7 hours of being sworn in, we voted to re-open the govt. Senate leaders are abandoning their responsibility and sitting on their hands while 800K federal workers are a day away from their next paycheck being withheld. This is outrageous even by Washington standards.

html: I’ve been hearing from constituents who are looking at filing for unemployment to cover their most basic bills. This shutdown is hurting families in real ways & its impacts will accelerate if nothing is done. Let’s end this embarrassing shutdown & move on in a constructive way.

html: Last night I voted to re-open the govt & fund it at levels agreed to by the GOP Sen. in December. A shutdown represents a catastrophic failure of our system. The American people & our federal workers deserve much better. Let's get back on track & work together to deliver results.

html: On Day 1, I supported bills to end the shutdown and new House rules to restore regular order & make Congress more transparent. There's a long session ahead, but we're already starting to see change take hold in Washington.
text:
On Day 1, I supported bills to end the shutdown and new House rules to restore regular order & make Congress more transparent. 

There's a long session ahead, but we're already starting to see change take hold in Washington.

html: The new House rules will set a framework of reform and reaffirm Americans’ faith in their government. We must be able to take on bold challenges, defend hard-won progress, and restore regular order. These rules take us in that direction.
text: The new House rules will set a framework of reform and reaffirm Americans’ faith in their government. We must be able to take on bold challenges, defend hard-won progress, and restore regular order. These rules take us in that direction.

html: As someone who has run a small business, I could not imagine receiving a paycheck while any of my employees are working without pay. My first official act as a member of Congress is to reject a paycheck until Congress does its job and the government is re-opened.pic.twitter.com/FpjPZfFi6s
